title: Letter: Trump’s Teenage Temperament
text: Re “ Donald Trump, Middle-School President ,” by Andrew Rosenthal (column, nytimes.com , Feb. 8): Your comparison of President Trump to middle-school students is blatantly unfair — to middle-school students, that is. Though at times middle-school students are Trump-like in their blinding self-absorption, cruel ad hominem attacks and insatiable quest for attention by creating endless drama, they eventually grow up — unlike Mr. Trump. Despite their mercurial moodiness, middle schoolers express more joy in an hour than Mr. Trump has expressed in the four long weeks of his administration. In these dark times we must remember that the survival of both middle schools and democracies requires the presence of adults in the room. RON NASON Tucson The writer is a middle-school librarian. A version of this letter appears in print on February 21, 2017, on Page A22 of the New York edition with the headline: Trump’s Temperament. Today's Paper | Subscribe
